text: The National Assembly (Spanish: Asamblea Nacional) is the legislative branch of the government of Ecuador that replaced the National Congress in 2009, under the 2008 Constitution. The current President of the Assembly is CÃ©sar Litardo, as of 2019. Within Ecuador, the National Assembly has the power to pass laws, while appointment of judges to the National Court of Justice is done by a separate Judicial Council. ==References== Category:Politics of Ecuador Category:Organizations based in Ecuador Category:Unicameral legislatures
title: National Assembly (Ecuador)
